intro: Sclerolaena comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, adapting to the tropical climate of its native region. It has a low-growing habit with a branched stem and is often found in open, sunny areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
